title: Seed-QMS Template Divergence: Systematic Drift Between Dual-Template Architecture

comment:

ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS:
- 5 contributing factors identified, all supported by evidence
- Primary root cause (no procedural guidance for dual-template architecture) is well-supported
- Contributing root cause (submodule boundary partitions changes) is structurally valid
- Analysis correctly characterizes this as systemic procedural gap, not isolated oversight

CAPA ASSESSMENT:
- CAPA-001 (Corrective): Appropriately remediates existing divergence across all 9 templates
- CAPA-002 (Preventive): Addresses root cause via TEMPLATE-CR usage guide update
- CAPA-003 (Preventive): Addresses QA checklist gap in SOP-002 Section 7.3
- Mix of 1 corrective + 2 preventive is appropriate for systemic procedural gap

FORMATTING: Consistent throughout. Tables, section numbering, horizontal rules, and markdown all clean.
TRACEABILITY: All referenced CRs and SOPs properly cited.
QUALITY BAR: Meets or exceeds INV-012 standard in depth, evidence, and CAPA structure.

REVIEWER ASSIGNMENT: No TU assignment needed. This is a purely procedural investigation with no code changes proposed in this document. Child CRs during CAPA execution will undergo their own review cycles.
